abstract: The DirecTV Group agreed to sell television programming through AT&T as part of discounted packages of services that include Internet access and phone calling, the companies said.
snippet: The DirecTV Group agreed to sell television programming through AT&T as part of discounted packages of services that include Internet access and phone calling, the companies said.
lead_paragraph: The DirecTV Group agreed to sell television programming through AT&T as part of discounted packages of services that include Internet access and phone calling, the companies said. The deal will take effect in February, after AT&T’s contract with Dish Network, its current television partner, expires. The partnership lets AT&T compete with cable companies’ “triple play” plans in markets where AT&T, the nation’s biggest phone company, does not have its own television service. Terms of the multiyear deal were not disclosed.

headline.main: DirecTV to Provide Programming Through AT&T
headline.print_headline: DirecTV To Provide Programming Through AT&T
